content.rendered:
FOREIGN AFFAIRS CLUB OF INDIA

Regd. Under Government Of India

SINCE 1992

Foreign Affairs club of india (faci award)

It may be noted here that the Foreign affairs club of India has instituted the prestigious Foreign affairs club of India International award (FACI International award ). It is given to those persons who have made significant contribution to the society and lifetime achievements in various field such as Foreign affairs,Culture,Peace,education,Social service, Business and industry, Health and any other related fields related to mankind and the world. 

FACI International award consists of a Diploma, A Citation and a beautiful trophy.

In the past FACI International awards has been given to her excellency Madam Mairam Akayeva wife of Mr. Askar Akayeva, The President of Kyrgyzstan for her exceptional contribution in serving the handicapped and social discarded children through various social welfare program. She has also provided all sorts of assistance to Orphans and the Handicapped children of low income family by conducting free educational,medical and social welfare program.

The International award has also been given to Shanakar dayal Sharma (Former President of India), R. Venkata Ramana ( Former President of India), A.P Venkatswaran (Former Foreign Secretary), Ramesh Bhandari (Former Foreign Secretary and Governor), Mark Runacres (Former High Commissioner of UK), Mr. Karl Peterlik (The Austrian Ambassador to India), Mr. Zang Xuyong (Minister in Chinese Embassy), Mr. Victor Evuaege (Argentina Ambassador), Mr. Bvyski (Poland Ambassador to India) and many other deserving persons…..

Her excellency Madam Mairam Akayeva wife of Mr. Askar Akayeva, (The President of Kyrgyzstan ) receiving the FACI International Award for National Integration and social service from Chairman Dr. Shyamsundar Mohapatra (Former member of Parliament, Loksabha and Rajyasabha) at Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan, Looking on are Secretary general Mr. R.N Anil and International observer Mr. Tushar Gandhi (Grand son of Mahatma Gandhi)

Shankar Dayal Sharma About this soundpronunciation (help·info) (19 August 1918 – 26 December 1999) was the ninth President of India, serving from 1992 to 1997. Prior to his presidency, Sharma had been the eighth Vice President of India, serving under R. Venkataraman. He was also the Chief Minister (1952–1956) of Bhopal State, and Cabinet Minister (1956–1967), holding the portfolios of Education, Law, Public Works, Industry and Commerce, National Resources and Separate Revenue. He was the President of the Indian National Congress in 1972–1974 and returned to the Government as Union Minister for Communications from 1974 to 1977.

Ramaswamy Venkataraman, 4 December 1910 – 27 January 2009) was an Indian lawyer, Indian independence activist and politician who served as a Union Minister and as the eighth President of India. Venkataraman was born in Rajamadam village in Tanjore district, Madras Presidency. He studied law and practised in the Madras High Court and the Supreme Court of India. In his young age, he was an activist of the Indian independence movement and participated in the Quit India Movement. He was appointed as the member of the Constituent Assembly and the provisional cabinet.

Mr. Ayilam Panchapakesha Venkateswaran (2 August 1930 – 2 September 2014) was an Indian diplomat, former Foreign Secretary of India and former Chairman of Asia Centre, Bangalore, rated by many as one of the most efficient foreign secretaries of India. The circumstances in which he resigned from the Indian Foreign Service made news at that time and drew widespread comments in the media.

Mr. Romesh Bhandari (29 March 1928 – 7 September 2013) was an Indian Foreign Secretary, former Lieutenant Governor of Delhi, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, and former governor of Tripura, Goa and Uttar Pradesh.

Mr. Mark Runacres (Former High Commissioner of UK)

Mr. Zhang Yan (Ambassador of China to India)

Mr. Zhou Gang (Ambassador of China to India)

Mr. Iprahim Dowek , First Ambassador of Israel

to India

Kirill V. NOVIKOV ( Russian Ambassador to India )

Ellsworth F. Bunker (United States Ambassador to India)

Attaullah Nasser Zia ( Afghanistan Ambassador to India )

AND MANY OTHERS....
